required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Change and Efficacy of Duloxetine in Patients With Co-Morbid Depression & Soft Tissue Discomfort Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Functional Change and Efficacy of Duloxetine in Patients With Major Depression and Co-Morbid Soft Tissue Discomfort Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of this study is to determine the time course of duloxetine efficacy on the symptoms of Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)and on the symptoms of Soft Tissue Discomfort Syndrome(STDS) via use of 24-hour Actigraph™ measures.
We hypothesize that there will be a reduction in both MDD and STDS symptoms in MDD patients with co-morbid STDS symptoms. We further hypothesize that there will be a rapid improvement in functional outcome ratings and 24-hour activity in MDD patients with co-morbid STDS symptoms which may occur even before the antidepressant effect is observed.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week One of Treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline; Week 6 and Week 8 of Treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 17 years old
- All races and ethnicity
- DSM IV-TR Axis I diagnosis of MDD
- Co-morbid STDS
- Baseline 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating > 13
Exclusion Criteria:
- Primary Axis I disorder other than MDD
- History of mania or psychosis
- Actively suicidal
- Required hospitalization
- A alcohol or substance abuse or dependence within the preceding 3 months
- Pregnant or nursing
- Unstable medical condition (other than STDS)
- Narrow-angle glaucoma
- Sensitivity to duloxetine, concurrent antidepressant, tranquilizer, or mood stabilizer use
- Hepatic or renal insufficiency

facility.name: Depression Research Unit, University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The investigator has succumb to serious health issues which prevents him from physically inputting data in the system. certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Data is unavailable for the following reasons: investigator has succumb to serious health conditions preventing him from entering data, and study team members no longer work for the university and cannot be reached to input data despite efforts.
